title: How to Make Cashew Nut Cheese (Vegan)

steps.headline: Pour the cashew nuts into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Cover them with fresh water and leave to soak for 2 hours.

steps.headline: Drain the nuts.
steps.description: Put the drained nuts into the blender. Add the water and the remaining ingredients as well.

steps.headline: Blend the cashews until smooth.
steps.description: Every now and then it's a good time to stop the blender and move around any cashews caught up in the blades to ensure all of them are blended. Add a little more water if needed to achieve a smooth consistency.

steps.headline: Pour the cashew cheese into a bowl and cover with a tea towel, upended plate or lid.
steps.description: Leave it to sit in a cool place for 24 hours. The cheese will solidify as it sits.

steps.headline: After 24 hours, place the cashew cheese in an airtight container.
steps.description: It will keep in the fridge for up to 5 days.

text: Pour the cashew nuts into the mixing bowl. Cover them with fresh water and leave to soak for 2 hours. Drain the nuts. Put the drained nuts into the blender. Add the water and the remaining ingredients as well. Blend the cashews until smooth. Every now and then it's a good time to stop the blender and move around any cashews caught up in the blades to ensure all of them are blended. Add a little more water if needed to achieve a smooth consistency. Pour the cashew cheese into a bowl and cover with a tea towel, upended plate or lid. Leave it to sit in a cool place for 24 hours. The cheese will solidify as it sits. After 24 hours, place the cashew cheese in an airtight container. It will keep in the fridge for up to 5 days.
